articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Phil Stewart, Steve Holland
articles.description: Israel faced a missile attack on Sunday as Iran said it reserved all options to defend itself after unprecedented U.S. strikes that President Donald Trump said had obliterated its key nuclear facilities.
articles.title: Israel under missile attack, Iran says all options open after US strikes

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: With his unprecedented decision to bomb Iran’s nuclear sites, directly joining Israel’s air attack on its regional arch-foe, U.S. President Donald Trump has done something he had long vowed to avoid - intervene militarily in a major foreign war.
articles.title: Strikes on Iran mark Trump's biggest, and riskiest, foreign policy gamble

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian military said the activity in the area prevented Russia from sending a significant number of its forces to Donetsk.
articles.title: Ukraine fighting 10,000 Russian troops in Kursk region, Ukrainian commander says

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: A little over a month ago, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appeared to have been shunted to the shadows by U.S. President Donald Trump, who hopscotched the Middle East without visiting Israel, traditionally Washington's closest regional ally.
articles.title: Despite clashes with US presidents, Israel's Netanyahu usually gets his way

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Airlines continued to avoid large parts of the Middle East on Sunday after U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, according to flight tracking website FlightRadar24, with traffic already skirting airspace in the region due to recent missile exchanges.
articles.title: Airlines keep avoiding Middle East airspace after US attack on Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: London police on Sunday said they had charged seven Iranians with grievous bodily harm after a reported fight at a protest near the embassy last week.
articles.title: London police charge seven Iranians with assault after embassy incident

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan is "of course" a country and China lacks both the historical evidence and legal proof to back up its sovereignty claims, President Lai Ching-te said on Sunday in a strong rebuke to Beijing and its stepped up political and military pressure.
articles.title: Taiwan is 'of course' a country, president says in rebuke to China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have recovered the bodies of three hostages which had been held in the Gaza Strip since the Palestinian militant group Hamas' 2023 attack, the military and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israeli forces recover bodies of three hostages from Gaza

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: A leading Belarusian opposition figure freed from prison by President Alexander Lukashenko said on Sunday his wife would continue to lead the exiled movement, and urged supporters to keep fighting for change and the release of political prisoners.
articles.title: Belarus opposition couple to keep fighting for release of political prisoners

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's prime minister, seeking to fend off calls for her resignation, said on Sunday all coalition partners have pledged support for her government, which she said would seek to maintain political stability to address threats to national security.
articles.title: Thai PM claims she has coalition support after resignation calls
